locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the 'riddle' of Jesus' promise that believers will do greater works. He contextualizes this through the Ascension and the shift from Christ's localized physical presence to his universal spiritual presence.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong focus on the 'because I go to the Father' clause as the hermeneutical key. Good historical-redemptive sweep.

illocutie.beschrijving: The primary force is Assertive (explaining the text) and Expressive (sharing the preacher's personal struggle with the text). It moves toward Commissive in the final section.
voorbeelden: I first attempted to preach during the summer of 1937.
Jesus submitted to limitations in being in the flesh.
He can help in our needy hour.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To relieve the hearer of the burden of 'doing' by showing it is Christ's power, and to inspire hope in the future of the church.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit through the discussion of Christ's non-localized presence, but the Holy Spirit is not explicitly named as the agent of the 'greater works'.

voorbeelden: The question was whether this subject should read...
He could not be both here and there.
Hear a part of what he says.
Look at the procession of 'made-whole' people.
I have never dared to use as a text.
I, for one, have always fallen back from these words.
How glad must every Christian be.
Whatsoever ye shall ask in my name, that will I do.
He can help in our needy hour.
He can heal us when we ask.
commissieven.kwaliteit: High quality in the final section, though often framed as 'He can' (potential) rather than 'He does' (actual).

voorbeelden: We have that [the death and resurrection] as accomplished truth.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher acts more as a witness to a fact than a distributor of a sacrament.

indicatoren: Extensive autobiographical narrative about preaching since 1937.
Long hypothetical illustration about airplanes and pilgrims in Jerusalem.
Detailed explanation of the 'riddle' vs 'puzzle' distinction.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of the preacher's intellectual journey rather than a participant in a divine event.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is informed about the possibility of power, but not necessarily 'powered' by the word.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Strongly tied to the text of John 14, but often kept in the third person ('He can help').
voorbeelden: He can heal us when we ask, for he is at God's right hand.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Highly autobiographical; the preacher's own struggle with the text is the narrative arc.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Used mostly in the final third to apply the comfort of the Ascension.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to invite the hearer to 'look' and 'behold'.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant mode; talking about Jesus, the disciples, and the history of the church.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere for the first 60% of the sermon.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Preacher's history and Jesus' earthly ministry.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological truths about the nature of the Ascension.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'now' of the congregation's ability to pray.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon avoids moralistic legalism (Assertive -> Directive).

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the difficulty of the text (Assertive) to the promise of Christ's presence (Commissive).
voorbeelden: Because I go unto my Father... He can help in our needy hour.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The link is established through the 'Toezegging' (Promise) of Christ's universal presence.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Christ is gone unto his Father... We may call on him.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions primarily to explain a difficult text and offer comfort based on the objective facts of the Ascension.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: This is Jesus talking, who split the centuries in two.
sterke_punten.effect: Establishes the supreme authority of the speaker of the text.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The first 400 words are about the definition of riddles and the preacher's career.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event in the final movement where the 'greater works' are applied to the present, but remains a 'talk about' for the majority.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher describes the sacrament of the Word more than he enacts it.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, Christ's words are treated as the ultimate authority.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as a witness/explainer rather than a direct herald.
tekstueel_bewijs: if they be the word of my Lord, I will trust them.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Low. The Spirit is the 'missing link' in the explanation of how Christ is present everywhere.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher trusts the 'force and fire' of Christ to act.
tekstueel_bewijs: The force and fire of Christ Jesus do not belong in any past.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Implicitly, through the 'centerpiece of the gospel'.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Strong in the 'Greater works yet shall Christ's people do' section.
tekstueel_bewijs: our fullest vision of God has not yet been beheld.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on past-tense assertives and needs more present-tense commissives/declaratives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: He can help in our needy hour.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: He helps you now in your needy hour.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often framed as a historical fact about the church's growth.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Directly promise the 'greater works' to the specific congregation.
voorbeeldzinnen: Through you, in this city, Christ promises to do what he never did in Galilee.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'I' (the preacher) and 'He' (Jesus), not enough 'You' (the congregation).
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Reduce the autobiographical 'riddle' intro and address the congregation's 'riddles' earlier.
voorbeeldzinnen: You have faced riddles that seem to hide God's face.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually quite good, avoiding legalism.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Maintain the current indicative-heavy flow but sharpen the illocutionary force.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A deeply Christocentric sermon that successfully navigates a difficult text, though it lingers too long in the 'constative' foyer before entering the 'performative' sanctuary.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'Self-Revelation' (the 1937 story); SAT focuses on whether the 'Commissive' of John 14 is actually delivered to the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the 'riddle' metaphor; SAT critiques it for delaying the illocutionary act.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is deferred by the preacher's focus on his own difficulty in 'daring' to preach the text.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Whatsoever ye shall ask in my name, that will I do.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High - this is the sacramental core.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: I first attempted to preach during the summer of 1937.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Preaching as Teaching' that breaks into 'Preaching as Event' only in the final peroration.
